reviews.review_msg: He has serious composure issues when dealing with students and takes offence to being compared to his mentor.

Ron was a great professor. I was a bit vary about the reviews, but all of them turn false. He truly cared about his students, he provided great feedback. If you put in the work, you will get the results you want.

Anyone who gives Professor Ron less than 5/5 is lying. He really cares for his students. He is hands down one of the best professors I have ever had. He is a fair marker and provides a ton of feedback on assignments and presentations. He is always accessible to answer questions and genuinely wants his students to succeed.

If you are enthusiastic about learning and developing your leadership skills, I highly recommend signing up to Ron Velin's courses. His classes are fun, real, and engaging. He doesn't look for perfection in our course deliverables, he simply wants us to give tour best efforts and continuously improve. To be honest, one class/week was not enough.

Ron is one of my favourite professors I had at SFU! From the beginning of the course he took the time to get to know each student and made the classroom very inclusive. I looked forward to lecture every week! The work was on a variety of interesting topics and creative projects. Ron gave great feedback I was able to effectively use.

Ron is an instructor who strives to help students and prepare them for the future. He focused on teaching concepts from lecture discussions and activities rather than notes from assignments. We spent the lessons having fun and learning a lot. I am grateful for teaching him about the concept of leadership.

I don't understand why this guy gets so low ratings. Ron is a great teacher who is passionate about teaching and who actually cares very well about his students. He conducts his lectures in very creative ways to keep the class engaged, and he tries to help out students who genuinely need help and help themselves as well.

With a small class, Ron was able to put in effort to get to know the students and help them learn. Assignments were focused on reflections, while lectures focused on leadership concepts, supplemented by discussions & activities. Ron is caring and will try to make class fun. We always ran out of time, and so he said he will work on time management.

Ron should not be teaching considering how he handles his class/curriculum. In lectures, Ron takes his time to interview students in front of the class entire class. He will demand answers from students - even when the class feels uncomfortable sharing. Would highly recommend any academic advisor to audit one of his courses. Ron needs help.

The class curriculum itself is very easy, but Ron manages to make class uncomfortable for everyone because he throws fits and wastes class time with his irrelevant rants. Ron is easily triggered by the simplest things in life and looks to his students for validation of his insecurities. He is condescending and rude - would not recommend this class

Ron is invasive and frustrating as a professor. He is a caring individual, but should not be teaching a 400-level course. You will not learn about successful leaders of notable organizations. You will maybe learn about a single leader in the entire course via an outdated and restrictive group project. Very weird, cult-like tendencies in this class.

Ron teaches his course as if he was the head of a sorority. If he does not like your character, you will suffer extremely (not just through poor grades, he will create problems in your life you never needed to deal with). This review sounds bias, but last semester more than half of his class filed a complaint.

Ron is an engaging lecturer who makes a 3 hour lecture feel like 30 minutes, and he tailors his feedback to fit each student individually. This class would be the only course I have taken in my whole degree that places value in self development and reflection, which has tremendous importance in leadership and life in general.

Ron is a very caring individual who puts his all into this course, however this should not be a class at Beedie. If you are not an open/outgoing/fake business type person than this class will be, as a previous classmate stated, trying. This class is called leadership but there is no leadership aspect to any part of the course, just reflections.

Ron is akin to a baked yogi parody of Rob Riggle, but nevertheless earnest, involved, and genuine. The course is entertaining and a valuable chance to practice one's interpersonal skills, but if one does not fully subscribe to the intangible values Ron espouses (i.e. your inner purpose, true self, etc.), playing along can be a bit trying at times.

Best professor and class I've had in my 4 years at SFU. He really cares about his students. Be prepared to participate, attend classes, and talk about a lot of self-reflection. Must be willing to open up about yourself to the class and really reflect in the learning journals. No midterm and no final! Easy to do well if you take time to reflect.

awesome professor and really cares about your progress. You should take this course seriously because you can benefit a lot from it without worrying too much about your grades. He's a good marker  Oh and make sure you participate and do well in your learning journals. You will learn a lot from this class m

He's a good marker  Oh and make sure you participate and do well in your learning journals. You will learn a lot from this class

Extremely caring and helpful with students. Wants them to do their best. However, he is quite disorganized, shifts deadlines, and was unable to complete all the content  he wanted to cover within the allotted time. He literally scheduled an extra class during the exam period to complete unfinished content.

Super helpful and engaging professor. He genuinely cares about all his students. He wants you to do your best and will try to bring that out of you. Note: Very self reflective course so if that's not your type of thing then maybe avoid it.  Ron is a bit disorganized but it's only because he is tries to change the class to best fit student needs.

Great professor! I love his teaching style, and how he designs the course to be hands-on. Probably one of the best courses I've taken at SFU. He really cares about his students, and makes sure everyone is on the same page. Take his class you won't regret it!
